gw.plugin.payment

Interface IDirectBillPayment

  • All Superinterfaces:
    com.guidewire.pl.system.integration.plugins.internal.InternalPlugin, java.rmi.Remote

    public interface IDirectBillPayment
extends com.guidewire.pl.system.integration.plugins.internal.InternalPlugin
    This plugin provides hooks to the distribution of direct bill money.

    • Method Detail

      • allocatePayment

        void allocatePayment(DirectBillPayment payment,
                   MonetaryAmount amount)
        Provides an opportunity to modify the existing DirectBillPayment, with payment-to-apply values.
        Parameters:
        payment - the payment to modify
        amount - the amount of the payment to distribute. If larger than the payment amount, then the excess funds are taken from default unapplied.

      • allocateCredits

        void allocateCredits(DirectBillPayment payment)
        Provides an opportunity to modify the existing DirectBillPayment, with payment-to-apply values.
        Parameters:
        payment - the payment to modify; must contain the negative invoice items causing the credit distribution

        amount - the amount to distribute

        Parameters:

        amount - the amount of the credits to distribute

      • allocateWithOverrides

        void allocateWithOverrides(DirectBillPayment payment,
                         MonetaryAmount amount,
                         java.util.Map<InvoiceItem,MonetaryAmount> overrideItems)
        Parameters:
        payment - to distribute to
        amount - the amount of the payment to distribute. If larger than the payment amount, then the excess funds are taken from default unapplied.
        overrideItems - a map of invoice items to the override amounts they have been given

      • allocateWithOverrides

        void allocateWithOverrides(DirectBillPayment payment,
                         MonetaryAmount amount,
                         java.util.List<? extends DBPaymentDistItemGroup> groups)
        Parameters:
        payment - to distribute to
        amount - of the payment to distribute. If larger than the payment amount, then the excess funds are taken from default unapplied.
        groups - A list of the groups on the payment. If the override amount on a group is null then it was not overridden.

      • allocatePolicyPeriod

        void allocatePolicyPeriod(DirectBillPayment directBillPayment,
                        MonetaryAmount amount,
                        java.util.Set<InvoiceItem> otherEligiblePayerInvoiceItems)
        Provides an opportunity to modify the existing DirectBillPayment that targets a policy period, with payment-to-apply values.
        Parameters:
        directBillPayment - the payment to modify
        amount - the amount of the credits to distribute
        otherEligiblePayerInvoiceItems - the other invoice items that are eligible to be paid which are not associated with the policy period. all items that are eligible to be paid and associated with the specified policy period are already on the payment and can be retrieved by calling directBillPayment.DistItems. Not used in the out of the box implementation.

      • allocateForRedistribution

        void allocateForRedistribution(DirectBillPayment payment,
                             MonetaryAmount amount)
        For allocating the excess funds on the payment
        Parameters:
        payment - The payment with excess funds that we intend to redistribute
        amount - The amount of excess funds available for redistribution

      • allocateForRedistribution

        void allocateForRedistribution(DirectBillPayment payment,
                             java.util.Map<Charge,AllocationPool> chargeToAmountMap)
        For allocating money to charges during redistribution.
        Parameters:
        payment - the payment to modify.
        chargeToAmountMap - map of charge to amount to allocate to that charge's invoice items

      • allocateWriteoffs

        java.util.List<InvoiceItemAllocation> allocateWriteoffs(ChargeGrossWriteoff chargeWriteoff)
        Parameters:
        chargeWriteoff - being executed
        Returns:
        a list of invoice item - amount to writeoff pairs

      • addPositiveItemsDistributionCriteria

        RestrictionBuilder<InvoiceItem> addPositiveItemsDistributionCriteria(java.lang.Iterable<InvoiceItem> negativeInvoiceItems)
        Returns a RestrictionBuilder that specifies additional restrictions to be used when determining InvoiceItems to which to distribute credits.

        These restrictions will be included with the defaults that ensure the items are on the same payer account, are positive, and are not yet settled so there is no necessity to also include them.

        This adds restrictions to implement the out-of-the-box behavior of the credit charge qualification and credit start date option features. (Note: Same Payer Account is the base target and adds no restrictions.)

        This can return null or an empty restriction builder if no additional restrictions are required.

        Parameters:
        negativeInvoiceItems - the credit InvoiceItems, which should be negative and belong to the same Charge and Account Payer.
        Returns:
        a RestrictionBuilder that specifies additional restrictions to be used when determining positive items to which to distribute. This builder will be modified by the calling code to add innate restrictions, so implementers should take care not to reuse it.

      • addInvoiceItemsDistributionCriteria

        RestrictionBuilder<InvoiceItem> addInvoiceItemsDistributionCriteria(DirectBillMoneyRcvd moneyRcvd)
        Returns a RestrictionBuilder that specifies additional restrictions to be used when determining InvoiceItems to which to distribute a Direct Bill Payment.
        Parameters:
        moneyRcvd - The DirectBillMoneyRcvd to be distributed to invoice items.
        Returns:
        a RestrictionBuilder that specifies additional restrictions to be used when determining positive items to which to distribute.

      • addInvoiceItemsDistributionCriteriaForUnappliedFunds

        RestrictionBuilder<InvoiceItem> addInvoiceItemsDistributionCriteriaForUnappliedFunds(ZeroDollarDMR zeroDollarDMR)
        Returns a RestrictionBuilder that specifies additional restrictions to be used when determining InvoiceItems to which to distribute excess unapplied funds.
        Parameters:
        zeroDollarDMR - The ZeroDollarDMR representing unapplied funds to be distributed as part of a distribution.
        Returns:
        a RestrictionBuilder that specifies additional restrictions to be used when determining positive items to which to distribute.

      • addInvoiceItemsDistributionCriteriaForAccountCredits

        RestrictionBuilder<InvoiceItem> addInvoiceItemsDistributionCriteriaForAccountCredits(Account account,
                                                                                   java.lang.Iterable<InvoiceItem> negativeInvoiceItems)
        Returns a RestrictionBuilder that specifies additional restrictions to be used when determining InvoiceItems to which to distribute excess unapplied funds.
        Parameters:
        account - The account that all invoice items will belong to in the restriction builder.
        negativeInvoiceItems - the credit InvoiceItems, which should be negative and belong to the same Account Payer.
        Returns:
        a RestrictionBuilder that specifies additional restrictions to be used when determining positive items to which to distribute.
